nodes.bodyText: These changes should not be merged until we release EH.

nodes.diffHunk:

-        Map<Symbol, UnknownDescribedType> sourceFilters, Map<Symbol, Object> receiverProperties,

nodes.bodyText: I'd dump it into receiver options. And probably pull in is session enabled, too

nodes.bodyText: I know we had unused sessionenabled. But add another method rather than everything in this method
This doesn't need to be a mutable object. That's why the other fields are read-only.
The options don't seem to be propagated here.

             final ReceiverOptions receiverOptions = new ReceiverOptions(receiveMode, prefetchCount);

nodes.bodyText: You don't need to create dedicated fields now. A reference to the receiverOptions is held by the class.
Since this is a normal link creation, we don't need isSession.

      */

nodes.bodyText: This would be an overload where you don't need "isSession" because we'd have a sessionId. And the parameter would be at the end.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -45,4 +45,23 @@
      */
     Mono<AmqpReceiveLink> createReceiveLink(String linkName, String entityPath, ReceiveMode receiveMode,
         boolean isSession, String transferEntityPath, MessagingEntityType entityType);
+
+    /**
+     * Creates or gets an existing receive link. The same link is returned if there is an existing receive link with the
+     * same {@code linkName}. Otherwise, a new link is created and returned.
+     *
+     * @param linkName The name of the link.
+     * @param entityPath The remote address to connect to for the message broker.
+     * @param transferEntityPath Path if the events should be transferred to another link after being received from this
+     *     link.
+     * @param receiveMode {@link ReceiveMode} to use when creating the link.
+     * @param isSession to use when creating the link.
+     * @param sessionId to use when creating the link.
+     * @param transferEntityPath to use when creating the link.
+     * @param entityType {@link MessagingEntityType} to use when creating the link.
+     *
+     * @return A new or existing receive link that is connected to the given {@code entityPath}.
+     */
+    Mono<AmqpReceiveLink> createReceiveLink(String linkName, String entityPath, ReceiveMode receiveMode,

nodes.bodyText: I'd be inclined to create another method createConsumer and remove the isSession. One createconsumer for normal receives, one for sessions, and another one to support transactions in the future.
Why is it always false? If later on, you're inferring it from the presence of a sessionId, the "enableSession" isn't required.

Doc update: Creates a receive link for sessions.
Since this is similar to the method above, I had mentioned to add the "SessionId" to the end of the parameter list as an overload. This would be easier to consume.

nodes.bodyText: Since these are performing two different operations, and you have created a separate method in ReactorSession for creating a consumer with a sessionId. This should call that.
This wouldn't work because we need a session enabled queue. You'd have to update the ARM template to create one.

commit.message: Added session queue creation in ARM

nodes.bodyText: Reformat the code. There are two spaces here.
Why do we need another constructor? This is only used in SBCB to pass to the receiver.
"Id of the session to receive messages from."
